title: log_prob function returns inf for large values
body_html:
Bug

The log_prob function for a distribution returns inf for very large values.

Reproduce

In[56]: x = dist.Normal(torch.tensor(0.), torch.tensor(1.))
In[57]: x.log_prob(torch.tensor(1.0e22))
Out[57]: tensor(-inf.)

Expected Behaviour

But, scipy stat library seems to handle this better

st.norm.logpdf(1e22,0,1)
Out[58]: -5e+43

This seems to me like a bug, or am I missing something here related to how the functions are defined?

## Bug

The `log_prob` function for a distribution returns `inf` for very large values. 

## Reproduce

```python

In[56]: x = dist.Normal(torch.tensor(0.), torch.tensor(1.))
In[57]: x.log_prob(torch.tensor(1.0e22))
Out[57]: tensor(-inf.)

```
## Expected Behaviour

But, scipy stat library seems to handle this better
```python
st.norm.logpdf(1e22,0,1)
Out[58]: -5e+43
```

This seems to me like a bug, or am I missing something here related to how the functions are defined?
